title: 'Time for Johnson to go': readers on unlawful prorogation ruling
text:
You have been reacting in the comments to judges ruling that the suspension of parliament was unlawful

‘Incredible considering how controversial and significant this is’

The fact that the 11 justices came back unanimous is incredible considering how controversial and significant this is. And it should show that it is absolutely the correct, objective outcome based on the constitutional principles our democracy is built on. No doubt the judges will be accused of being political again but if people could actually look at this objectively rather than through the leave/remain lens, they would realise the judges couldn’t have arrived at a different conclusion. manicswiregirl

‘A reminder that decency still exists in the corridors of power’

Just when you think your country is descending into a banana-republic shit-hole, along comes beautiful British justice and reminds you that decency still exists in the corridors of power. Good times. mannyklein

‘Surely now this is a case for a vote of no confidence’

Surely now this is a case for a vote of no confidence in the prime minister and the government. They sought to bypass parliament, misled the house, misled the Queen and all to avoid scrutiny of their peers and the democracy of our country. To be fair if Boris had any morality or shame at all he’d resign. But of course he won’t. Owlyross

‘Terrific’

Parliament has not been prorogued. This is the unanimous decision of all 11. Speakers can reconvene parliament, gov need do nothing. Terrific. Tenthred

‘Stick that in your pipe and smoke it Johnson’

Stick that in your pipe and smoke it Johnson. Six defeats in the HoC in a week, a majority of -44 and now the law tells him he’s acted illegally, his government’s claim to legitimacy does seem rather threadbare. It’s remarkable that starting with Cameron we’ve had the succession of the worst PMs in British history all within the space of three years and guess what, they’re all Tory. kumano

‘Let’s hope this is the start of the process to achieve what is truly in the nation’s best interests’

Looks like Boris and his cabal will be returning to the UK sooner than expected. Let’s hope this is the start of the process to achieve what is truly in the nation’s best interests, as opposed to the select few who seem intent on achieving Brexit no matter what the cost. briski71

‘Time for Johnson to go’

Prorogation was unlawful. Fantastic. Time for Johnson to go. Pity there is no opposition. Ceterumcenseo1

‘Supporting the rule of law is something that unites our continent’

Unanimous. Good. The Judiciary is as one. It supports the rule of law.

That is a founding pillar of the EEC/EU. It is something uniting our continent. Something that Brexiters, (wishing to secede from international courts,) do not uphold. “She [Lady Hale] says it is for the Speaker to decide what happens next.” freespeechoneeach

‘My pride in Britain was lapsing but is a little bit restored’

They get it, these judges. So good to see. And Lady Hale is explaining it all so well. My pride in being British was lapsing, but is a little bit restored. Alednam

‘Now let’s call an election’

My thanks as a citizen to parliament, the supreme court and the speaker of the house for protecting our democracy from crony capitalism at it’s worst. Now let’s call an election, revoke A50 and consign this folly to the dustbin forever. thosefatpants
